quote480.quote: Men are more evanescent than pictures, yet one sorrows for lost friends, and pictures are my friends. I have none others. I am never long enough with men to attach myself to them; and whatever feelings of attachment I have are to material things.
quote480.author: John Ruskin

quote481.quote: If two friends ask you to judge a dispute, don't accept, because you will lose one friend; on the other hand, if two strangers come with the same request, accept because you will gain one friend.
quote481.author: Saint Augustine of Hippo

quote482.quote: I want my friend to miss me as long as I miss him.
quote482.author: Saint Augustine of Hippo

quote483.quote: To like and dislike the same things, this is what makes a solid friendship.
quote483.author: Sallust

quote484.quote: Friendship is almost always the union of a part of one mind with the part of another; people are friends in spots.
quote484.author: George Santayana

quote485.quote: Good friends are good for your health.
quote485.author: Irwin Sarason

quote486.quote: Friends show me what I can do, foes teach me what I should do.
quote486.author: Friedrich von Schiller

quote487.quote: Friends and acquaintances are the surest passport to fortune.
quote487.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote488.quote: You can't eat your friends and have them too.
quote488.author: Budd Schulberg

quote489.quote: If you have no friends to share or rejoice in your success in life -- if you cannot look back to those whom you owe gratitude, or forward to those to whom you ought to afford protection, still it is no less incumbent on you to move steadily in the path of duty; for your active excretions are due not only to society; but in humble gratitude to the Being who made you a member of it, with powers to save yourself and others.
quote489.author: Sir Walter Scott

quote490.quote: Old friends are best. King James used to call for his old shoes; they were easiest for his feet.
quote490.author: John Selden

quote491.quote: Friendship always benefits; love sometimes injures.
quote491.author: Seneca (Seneca the Elder)

quote492.quote: Those that are a friend to themselves are sure to be a friend to all.
quote492.author: Seneca (Seneca the Elder)

quote493.quote: Friendship is constant in all other things, Save in the office and affairs of love.
quote493.author: William Shakespeare

quote494.quote: Words are easy, like the wind; Faithful friends are hard to find.
quote494.author: William Shakespeare

quote495.quote: A friend should bear a friend's infirmities, But Brutus makes mine greater than they are.
quote495.author: William Shakespeare

quote496.quote: A friend is one that knows you as you are, understands where you have been, accepts what you have become, and still, gently allows you to grow.
quote496.author: William Shakespeare

quote497.quote: The friends thou hast, and their adoption tried, grapple them to thy soul with hoops of steel, but do not dull thy palm with entertainment of each new-hatched unfledged comrade.
quote497.author: William Shakespeare

quote498.quote: The only service a friend can really render is to keep up your courage by holding up to you a mirror in which you can see a noble image of yourself.
quote498.author: George Bernard Shaw

quote499.quote: But a lifetime of happiness! No man alive could bear it: it would be hell on earth.
quote499.author: George Bernard Shaw

quote500.quote: Friends come and go but enemies accumulate.
quote500.author: Arthur Bloch

quote502.quote: Friendships are fragile things and require as much care in handling as any other fragile and precious thing.
quote502.author: Randolph Silliman Bourne

quote503.quote: False friends are like our shadow, keeping close to us while we walk in the sunshine, but leaving us the instant we cross into the shade.
quote503.author: Christian Nevell Bovee

quote504.quote: Friendship is one of the most tangible things in a world which offers fewer and fewer supports.
quote504.author: Kenneth Branagh

quote505.quote: I value the friend who for me finds time on his calendar, but I cherish the friend who for me does not consult his calendar.
quote505.author: Robert Brault

quote506.quote: Thus much for thy assurance know; a hollow friend is but a hellish foe.
quote506.author: Nicholas Breton

quote507.quote: How delightful to find a friend in everyone.
quote507.author: Joseph Brodsky

quote508.quote: If we would build on a sure foundation in friendship, we must love friends for their sake rather than for our own.
quote508.author: Charlotte Bronte

quote509.quote: Love is like the wild rose-briar; Friendship like the holly-tree. The holly is dark when the rose-briar blooms, but which will bloom most constantly?
quote509.author: Emily Bronte

quote510.quote: Accountability in friendship is the equivalent of love without strategy.
quote510.author: Anita Brookner

quote511.quote: Friendship should be a private pleasure, not a public boast. I loathe those braggarts who are forever trying to invest themselves with importance by calling important people by their first names in or out of print. Such first-naming for effect makes me cringe.
quote511.author: John Mason Brown

quote512.quote: A friendship can weather most things and thrive in thin soil; but it needs a little mulch of letters and phone calls and small, silly presents every so often - just to save it from drying out completely.
quote512.author: Pam Brown

quote514.quote: Two persons cannot long be friends if they cannot forgive each other's little failings.
quote514.author: Jean De La Bruyere

quote515.quote: The rule of friendship means there should be mutual sympathy between them, each supplying what the other lacks and trying to benefit the other, always using friendly and sincere words.
quote515.author: Buddha

quote516.quote: A good friend who points out mistakes and imperfections and rebukes evil is to be respected as if he reveals a secret of hidden treasure.
quote516.author: Buddha

quote517.quote: An insincere and evil friend is more to be feared than a wild beast; a wild beast may wound your body, but an evil friend will wound your mind.
quote517.author: Buddha

quote518.quote: Friendship is a strong and habitual inclination in two persons to promote the good and happiness of one another. -
quote518.author: Eustace Budgell

quote519.quote: That is what friendship means. Sharing the prejudice of experience.
quote519.author: Charles Bukowski

quote520.quote: One of the surest evidences of friendship that one individual can display to another is telling him gently of a fault. If any other can excel it, it is listening to such a disclosure with gratitude, and amending the error.
quote520.author: Edward George Bulwer-Lytton

quote521.quote: Love is only chatter, friends are all that matter.
quote521.author: Gelett Burgess

quote522.quote: Win hearts, and you have hands and purses.
quote522.author: Lord Burleigh

quote523.quote: False friendship, like the ivy, decays and ruins the walls it embraces; but true friendship gives new life and animation to the object it supports.
quote523.author: Sir Richard Francis Burton

quote524.quote: A single rose can be my garden... a single friend, my world.
quote524.author: Leo Buscaglia
